titleInfo.title: LSU History Oral History Project: Sororities at LSU
titleInfo.subTitle: Marion Ferguson oral history interview, 1993

name.description: Ferguson was born on 18 May 1922 in Shreveport, La. Her father was a stockbroker and her mother a homemaker. She married John Ferguson. She attended Centenary College for two years, majoring in history and minoring in English, before completing her B.S. at LSU. Ferguson was instrumental in bringing the Zeta Tau Alpha Society to LSU, and she played an integral part in the building of their sorority house. Ferguson also served as Panhellenic director for LSU in the late 1940s and as president of the Zeta Tau Alpha House Corporation Board in the 1960s.
